Charminar is depicted as the ‘Arc De Triumph of the East’. It is said that Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutub Shah, the ruler of the Qutub Shahi Dynasty, constructed this monument as a memory of Queen Bhagwati.

 Some of the historians also believe that it is a monument constructed to commemorate the victory over a deadly plague. The four minarets signify four directions. It is also believed that those four minarets in this monument glorify the four Khalifas of Islam.


 This monument was built in the year 1591. It is 48.7 meters tall. The top floor has a mosque where people used to sit and pray to God. The first floor was used as a school for kids. This monument has a secret tunnel that connects with Golconda Fort. 

 The Indo-Islamic architecture of this monument is brilliant. In fact, it has become the symbol of tourism in Hyderabad. Charminar is an icon of the diverse history of India which continues to attract visitors from all over the world.
